newsitem.title: USA: Halliburton lets Landmark keep Stratworks.
newsitem.headline: Halliburton lets Landmark keep Stratworks.

text.p: Landmark Graphics Corp said on Wednesday that Halliburton Co had waived a requirement that would have obliged Landmark to sell Stratworks software application in order to complete its purchase of Landmark.
Landmark said it planned to keep Stratworks after Halliburton acquires it.
Under the terms of the $557 million acquisition, Halliburton is to issue about 10 million shares, or 0.574 of a share of its common stock for each share of Landmark common stock.
Landmark, which will become a wholly-owned subsidiary of Halliburton, is holding a special shareholders meeting on October 4 to vote on whether or not to accept the proposed acquisition.
Halliburton is an industrial and engineering company, while Landmark supplies exploration and production information systems for oil companies.
